Author: CPDD
Content: Hey, is there a way to make the response more like a human instead of sound like a robot? Do we have to change the prompt somehow?

Author: Nuo Ma @01.ai
Content: Thatâ€™s where prompt engineering kicks in. For example, the simplest form can be: Answer users question in childrenâ€™s book author. Users question: hi how are you today. Of course the requirements will be hidden from the user.

Author: Nix
Content: I see your on huggingface on the model card for the model so I am not sure your able to change the system prompt, I would suggest you go to https://huggingface.co/chat/, sign in, change the current model to Yi-1.5-34B-Chat, and then hitting activate model. That will switch it to use that model instead, and with huggingchat, your able to change the system prompt like Nuo mentioned to be able to have the model respond how you would like!

Author: CPDD
Content: <@556614243517202443> <@286272278898147329>  Thanks a lot! Will explore on the  https://huggingface.co/chat/.

Author: Nix
Content: Got it! Hope you have fun!

Author: CPDD
Content: Also I have one question,if I use Lora to finetune this model with additional training set, for my case chat mostly. Do you guys think prompt engineering will be necessary when using the model like Zero shot prompting

Author: Nuo Ma @01.ai
Content: I canâ€™t provide a direct answer, because this is heavily dataset or task-dependent.  For open source models (smaller compared to closed source ones), if you have a very specific downstream task (nl2sql, or answer in a certain style), then yes I think sft works better. As opposed to larger closed source models works fine with prompt engineering.

Author: CPDD
Content: Thanks, that makes sense.  The reason I am asking is, I am building an english learning app which has different scenarios(Like ordering food, traval, communication, etc). I added additional 10k+ chat data for SFT purpose. And applied quantization method to reduce the model size. It works in zero shot prompting. But the response quality are concerning(was using llama2 as base). So back to the topic, if I have different scenarios, in order not to do sft, I should provide the prompt for each scenario?

Author: CPDD
Content: Also can I use AWQ or GPTQ on Yi?

Author: CPDD
Content: Hi Nix, I have seen yi-1.5-34B-Chat on HuggingChat listed models. Do you have any ideas by any chance I can change this model from yi-1.5-34B-chat to a smaller one like yi-1.5-9B-Chat on the models section? I did not find a insert or change model option?

Author: Nix
Content: Sadly HuggingChat only has the models you see listed as they are added by the Huggingface team, to try Yi-1.5-9B, the only place I know where you can try it would be using it on your own computer with a program like LMStudio or Ollama

Author: Nix
Content: There might be a place online where it is being served with the option to change system prompt, but I do not know of any

Author: CPDD
Content: No worries at all. Good to know, which is good for Yi right, among all the models, they picked yi as showcase. I will spin up a instance to try Yi-1.5-9b on my end then.

Author: Nix
Content: Got it!, Hope it goes well for you
